info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:18PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mineral and west central Missoula Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 318 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Alberton, or 25 miles west of Missoula, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alberton and Ninemile. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 70 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for west central Montana.
